item.description: Today's episode is just awesome!

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on May 23, 2013
item.description:
Today's episode features songs from artists' with scheduled future visits to Vancouver. Today's episode welcomes guest and future CiTR host Michael. Enjoy songs from the following artists: The XX, The Temper Trap, The Neighbourhood, Yukon Blonde, Dan Croll, Surfer Blood, Delta Spirit, Foals, Jeff the Brotherhood, and Blue Hawaii
Please join me in this out of this world radio experience

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on May 9, 2013
item.description: Today's episode features quality tunes from Purity Ring, Crystal castles, ms mr, the neighbourhood (spelt with a ou!), van she, mother mother, blue hawaii and many more!

Tune in every Thursday from 11AM to 12PM

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on April 25, 2013
item.description:
One of my favourite bands performs in Vancouver! Purity Ring and Blue Hawaii perform at the Vogue Theatre.
Today's episode includes: Van she, is tropical, mr. little jeans, sweatshop union, purity ring, blue hawaii, crystal castles, ms mr, kaiser chiefs, TV on the radio and many more.

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on April 4, 2013
item.description:
Arrived late. Hahaha
So I'm a little tired and out of breath. I missed the 43 express bus and caught the 99B line. Epic fail.
Oh well, I still played some relentlessly awesome tracks (sticks tongue out)
item.itunes:subtitle: Decent episode

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on March 28, 2013

TODAY'S SHOW IS SOLID!
LISTEN TO RELENTLESSLY AWESOME TRACKS FROM MISUN, ALEX METRIC, MARK YARDLEY, RUFUS, THE TEMPER TRAP, ROBBY HUNTER BAND, HOW TO DRESS WELL, ATLAS GENIUS, MAGNETA LANE, CRYSTAL CASTLES, PURITY RING, THE SOFT MOON, AND MANY MORE

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on February 28, 2013
item.description: Today's episode had some hiccups here and there. I'm looking forward to bring my A game next week! Today's episode still features some of the coolest songs in the world right now! white lung hooves sky ferreira liz purity ring chvrches parallels wild belle grimes and did I mention white lung and purity ring?

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on December 13, 2012

Thom York, Crystal Castles, Naked and famous, tame impala, health, meltones, kontravoid, wavves, the population drops, the soft moon, and many more
Today's show features many awesome errors! I don't know about you... but I think there's nothing more entertaining than hearing someone mess up on a broadcast.

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on December 6, 2012

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on November 22, 2012
item.description:
Today's episode is all over the place. At least, I didn't make too mistakes in front of the microphone.
Today's episode features: metal, rock, pow-wow step, alternative, post-neo-punk, and many others.
Listen to Bison BC, Black manila, jeff the brotherhood, kitten, a tribe called red, the soft moon, the population drops, super magic hats, dillon, the pack AD and crystal castles
item.itunes:subtitle: Mood swings

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on November 8, 2012
item.description:
today's show features today's top artist, including hacienda, angus stone, the xx, crystal castles, fotoshop, haim, cults, city calm down, the population drops, hannah georgas, and many others...
what didn't make the cut? the 1975's You and How to Dress Well's Cold Nights (featuring Charli XCX)
item.itunes:subtitle: awesomeness is served best cold

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on November 1, 2012
item.description:
I'm pretty happy with today's featured tracks. Listen to the following: the population drops, crystal castles, ebsen & the witch, the bloody beetroots, fotoshop, toro y moi, metrc, the new division, carolyn mark, and fine times...
missing the cut this week "looking for love" by the chromatics, "you know what I mean" by the cults...didn't have enough time this week!
item.itunes:subtitle: solid show with some solid new tracks!

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on October 18, 2012
item.description: how's it going, everyone? today's show features several tracks from artists featured on citr's recent chart's list. today's episode is nearly error free. i'm a bit of a downer today because i didn't get much sleep last night. enjoy music from the following artists: the new division, keep shelly in anthens, pvt, reptile youth, ryan hemsworth, alpines, calamalka, lana del rey, needles//pins, man your horse, jessie ware, william fitzsimmons, rainy milo, jay arner, and the japandroids. ellie goulding misses the cut. i'm hesistant towards playing her music. she's quite popular/not quite alternative, but she was featured in one of nardwuar's interviews...and nardwuar is relentlessly awesome. oh well, maybe next time
item.itunes:subtitle: never played this much indie

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on October 11, 2012
item.description: how's it going, everyone? It's time to celebrate social media day! today's show features new songs from blackbird blackbird, blonds, the raveonettes, elizabeth rose, memoryhouse, secondhand heart, tokyo denmark sweden, ultraista, the coves, crystal castles, alexisonfire, adventure club, memoryhouse, calamalka, and the xx. today, we're not going to be hearing any purity ring or grimes. I'm a huge fan of purity ring but I have been playing purity ring almost every single week.
item.itunes:subtitle: Almost pretty good

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on September 27, 2012
item.description: mostly new stuff today! do you remember when I said I would play mostly new stuff every week from now on? well, this week's episode is an example of what I meant. Listen to some cool tracks from lana del rey, the shins, william fitzsimmons, purity ring, yukon blonde, the kills, crystal castles, gypsy and the cat, jahan lennon, austra, lonerism, crystal castles again, caribou, and blackbird blackbird...as well, as my normal rambling in between tracks...
item.itunes:subtitle: New new new!

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on September 20, 2012

item.itunes:subtitle: 1 year celebration and it's my birthday!

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on July 26, 2012

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on July 19, 2012
item.description: How's it going, everyone? Today's show features a relentlessly awesome tracklist that includes: Charli XCX, Santigold, The Bloody Beetroots, Purity Ring, Hinterland, The XX, Jakwob, Caribou, Ellie Goulding, Metric, Adventure Club, Secondhand Heart, Lights, Health and Oh Dear Vegas! In today's episode, I sound a little tired for a reason. I've worked 3 full shifts in a row. On top of that, I experienced an injury on Wednesday. On top of that, I only slept for 4 hours on Wednesday. I felt like taking a nap during the show!
item.itunes:subtitle: An insanely awesome tracklist feat. Santigold, The Bloody Beetroots, Caribour, Lights, Secondhand Heart, and many more

item.title: Dubstep edition
item.description: Today's episode features extraordinary futuristic sounds from the dubstep genre. Listen to the latest tracks from: Porter Robinson, Purity Ring, Hot Jambalaya, Adventure Club, Skrillex, Damian Marley, Sleigh Bells, AWOLNATION, Ill-esha, Brand New, Florence and the machine, Metric, Deftones, and Hot Panda (ended things with some alternative)
item.itunes:subtitle: Oh snap!

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on July 5, 2012
item.description: How's it going, everyone? I was listening to the playlist on the bus this morning. Today's playlist feels like 2-3 hours worth of programming packed into 1 hour. I've got the latest tracks from charli xcx, health, tv on the radio, purity ring, grimes, iron & wine, metric, secondhand heart, lights, diiv, japandroids, kennedy, and many more!
item.itunes:subtitle: New stuff! Today's show is relentlessly awesome

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on June 28, 2012
item.description:
Hip hip hooray! My show has 65% worth of Canadian content. Today's artists are: funeral suits, charlie mayfair, secondhand heart, maya laner, purity ring, sleuth bears, adventure club, lights, cobra and vulture, erika spring, blood diamonds, grimes, small black, japandroids, hunters, and hey ocean!
Hey check out my radio program's website! It's citrradio.wordpress.com!
item.itunes:subtitle: Quite the playlist! Today's show feature's an eccletic mix of folk, chillwave, rock, and others!

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on June 21, 2012
item.description: How's it going, everyone? I'm back! I visited Kingston Ontario for a National Campus Radio Conference last week. What a thrill! Learned a lot...actually, I probably learned more than most participants. I made a lot of friends! I exchanged a lot of opinions...Trust me. All in all, I'd attend it again. Anyways, I've got some excellent tracks ready for you. I'll start the hour with 5 tracks from Kingston's Sleuth Bears. One of the members was kind of enough to let me stay at her house. I promised her that I'd play them on my show. Go Sleuth Bears! Today, I'll play tracks from Health, Cobra & Vulture, Sleigh Bells, Purity Ring, Niki & the Dove, Adult Swim & Kia Motors America, Onuinu, Blood Diamonds, Grimes, Metric, Japandroids and many more
item.itunes:subtitle: I'm back! Sleuth Bears, Cobra and Vulture, Sleigh Bells, Niki & The Dove, Purity Ring, Figure, Japandroids and many more

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on June 7, 2012
item.description: Today's episode is filled with tiny errors and a rant about the headphones. I swear! I heard someone say, "Don't screw up" through my headphones during the broadcast. I'm positive it's not my imagination/conscious. It was a little creepy and it kind of threw me off a little. Next week, I'll wear my headphones a certain way so that I can still hear what's being broadcasted. Perhaps the station is haunted? I don't hear voices often. I promise. Today, I played tracks from Health, Purity Ring, Kimbra, Joywave, m83, Japandroids, Bassnectar, Blood Diamonds, Grimes, Metric, Jesse Ware, Sleigh Bells, and others!
item.itunes:subtitle: I hear voices! Music from Joywave, Japandroids, more Japandroids, Purity Ring, Health, M83, Grimes, and many more

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on May 31, 2012
item.description: What a dark and gloomy Thursday morning! Is Summer taking a holiday? How's it going, everyone? Today's episode features plenty of European tracks (...nothing out of the norm). Listen to new music from Jessie Ware, Funeral Suits, Metric, Grimes, Blood Diamonds, Hot Panda, SBTRKT, Cougarettes, Health, Tigermilk, Sound Remedy, and Laibach. What a diverse playlist! Am I right?
item.itunes:subtitle: Lots of femcon! Music from Jessie Ware, Grimes, Purity Ring, Funeral Suits, Tigermilk, Hot Panda, and many more

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on May 24, 2012
item.description: How's it going, everyone? Enjoy some sick tracks from Cougarettes, Zen Death Squad, Bjork, Funeral Suits, Cranberries, Health, Liftoff, Definitive Pulse, Sleigh Bells, Hey Ocean, Purity Ring, Death from Above 1979, Japandroids and many more! I've got everything from rock to pop to nu-gaze, and many more. I'm digging the playlist. How about you?
item.itunes:subtitle: Digging this playlist! Music from Bison, Cougarettes, Funeral Suits, Liftoff, Sleigh Bells, Death from Above 1979 and many more

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on May 17, 2012
item.description: I had a busy week! Just had some serious job interviews, including an interview that lasted over an hour! Imagine answering questions in front of two potential co-workers for over an hour. It's tougher than it sounds. I experienced a couple of sleepless nights. Yesterday, I spent the day in the good ole US of A. I think I "over-did-it" on the fast food. My bones are aching. I think I'll be in tip top shape for Friday. Anyways, here's a list of bands featured in today's program: Japandroids, Shadows on stars, definitive pulse, cranberries, meg myers, death from above 1979, sleigh bells, shotgun radio, mimi page, purity ring, catcall, health, local natives, bronx cheerleaders, and yeasayer. Originally, I had Kreayshawn on my list. I changed my mind at the last second. Nothing wrong with Kreayshawn. Kreayshawn was interviewed by Nardwuar "The human serviette" a while ago...and Nardwuar is relentlessly awesome. Maybe next week?
item.itunes:subtitle: Busy summers! Music from the Cranberries, Japandroids, Shadows on stars, made in japan, Health, Catcall, Sleigh Bells, Death from above 1979, Meg Myers and others

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on May 10, 2012
item.description: How's it going, everyone? Today's program showcases the diversity of music. I've got music from the various locations around the world, including Australia, Canada, the United States, and parts unknown. The show will surprise you as it makes transitions from moombacore to ambient rock to rock to R'n'B to the unknown. Listen to current tracks from Liftoff, We Barbarians, Meg Myers, Spirit Animals, Alexisonfire, Twin shadow, jakwob, made in japan, sleigh bells, japandroids, metric, purity ring and major lazer.
item.itunes:subtitle: We're just getting warmed up! Music from Flosstradamus, Liftoff, We Barbarians, Meg Myers, Twin Shadows, Spirit Animal and many more

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on May 3, 2012
item.description: How's it going, everyone? Are you looking forward to the summer? I've got a few projects to take care of during the summer. I'm looking forward to visiting Toronto in June! Just a heads up: CITR recently discussed various strengths and weaknesses at a semi-formal meeting. Do you have any suggestions? Forward them to CITR! Your voice will be heard. In today's program, I will play music from the following artists: Alexisonfire, Carlos Serrano, The Four String Upgrade, Sleigh Bells, Purity Ring, Gauntlet Hair, Florence and the Machine, Hey Ocean, Born Gold, Metric, Japandroids, Phyllis Dillon, Marcia Griffiths, Yuck, and Mr. Fogg. I wanted to play the new one from Man Without Country. Perhaps next time?
item.itunes:subtitle: Wet! Mildly warm! Grimey! Vancouver's summer is off to a poor start! Music from Sleigh Bells, Gauntlet Hair, Yuck, Mr Fogg, Marcia Griffiths, Phyllis Dillon, Japandroids, Metric, Florence and the Machine, Hey Ocean, Purity Ring, and many more!

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on April 26, 2012
item.description: How's it going, everyone? I'm back! I wasn't able to come in on April 19 because of final exams. That's okay! I'm back! And I have some pretty sick tracks to make up for last week's absence. I've got music from: The Ting Tings, M83, Gauntlet Hair, Van She, Strange Talk, Major Lazer, Yuck, Born Gold, Grimes, Japandroids, Middle Class Rut, Beautiful Small Machines, MNDR, and Band of Skulls. I've got a concert announcement! Check out Denver's Gauntlet Hair at the Waldorf on May 5.
item.itunes:subtitle: I'm back! Music from Purity Ring, The Ting Tings, M83, Gauntlet Hair, Yuck, Grimes, Middle Class Rut, Beautiful Small Machines, MNDR, Major Lazer, Amber of the Dirty Projectors, Van She, Strange Talk and many more

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on April 12, 2012
item.description: How's it going, everyone! I don't have anything interesting to say today! As a result, I am going to use a different format. Today's show will be all about the music. I've got music from: Alexisonfire, Gauntlet Hair, Cookies, Middle Class Rut, Japandroids, Beautiful Small Machines, Strange Talk, Born Gold, Huoratron, Gotye, Bullwack, Kasper Bjorke, Capital Cities, Moscow, Black Mountain and Grimes! I won't be hosting a show next week (April 19) because I have to take an exam on that day. Don't worry! I'll be back next next week (if they let me). See ya!
item.itunes:subtitle: Exams! Music from Middle Class Rut, Strange Talk, Japandroids, Grimes, and Cookies!

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on April 5, 2012
item.description: I will talk about some important details about the 5th annual AMS Block Party. The AMS Block Party features Mother Mother, The Boom Booms, Hedspin, MSTRKRFT, DJ President, Ryan Trax, and Maria in the Shower. Unfortunately, I will not play any tracks from the bands I just named. Instead, I will play music from... Digitalism, Van She, Moscow, Swimwear, Born Gold, Sleigh Bells, Weed, Gotye, JJ, A Place to Bury Strangers, Japandroids, Royal Headache, Crystal Castles. I've got some brand new Japandroids called "The House that Heaven Built" and some brand new A Place to Bury Strangers called "You are the one." Check it out!
item.itunes:subtitle: AMS Block Party edition! Music from Weed, Digitalism, Van She, Moscow, A Place to Bury Strangers, JJ, Japandroids and many more

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on March 29, 2012
item.description: In today's show, I attempt to conquer my fears of making a mistake! I have decided to go without a script. Unfortunately, I forgot to mention a few things. Oh well! Hear the following musicians: Polaris at Noon, Shiny Toy Guns (vintage), Young Liars, Teen Daze, Sound Remedy, Moscow, Capital Cities, Weed, Choir of Young Believers, Knxwledge, Zodiac, Japandroids, Sleigh Bells, College, Electric Youth, Grimes, Born Gold, and Brothers.

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on March 22, 2012

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on March 15, 2012
item.description: Today's program features an eclectic mix of music from various genres. Today's dominant genres are dub-step and electronica. I know dub-step has its haters (ahem, because of a few well-known artists). It doesn't matter! Almost every song has a shot at making it on the show. I don't discriminate :-)

item.title: Relentlessly Awesome - Broadcast on February 16, 2012
item.description: Today's program features some of my thoughts and opinions on relationships. Also, the program features A Place to Bury Strangers, Sleep Over, Schlachthofbronx, Tidus, Nguzunguzu, Young Astronaut, Yukon Blonde, Phedre, Lancealot, Young Liars, The Weeknd, and White Ring.
